speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Britain. A hall in Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Enter in state, CYMBELINE, QUEEN, CLOTEN,  and Lords at one door, and at another, CAIUS LUCIUS and Attendants

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Now say, what would Augustus Caesar with us?

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: When Julius Caesar, whose remembrance yet

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Lives in men's eyes and will to ears and tongues

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Be theme and hearing ever, was in this Britain

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And conquer'd it, Cassibelan, thine uncle,--

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Famous in Caesar's praises, no whit less

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Than in his feats deserving it--for him

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And his succession granted Rome a tribute,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Yearly three thousand pounds, which by thee lately

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Is left untender'd.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And, to kill the marvel,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Shall be so ever.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: There be many Caesars,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Ere such another Julius. Britain is

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A world by itself; and we will nothing pay

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: For wearing our own noses.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That opportunity

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Which then they had to take from 's, to resume

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: We have again. Remember, sir, my liege,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The kings your ancestors, together with

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The natural bravery of your isle, which stands

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As Neptune's park, ribbed and paled in

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With rocks unscalable and roaring waters,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With sands that will not bear your enemies' boats,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: But suck them up to the topmast. A kind of conquest

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Caesar made here; but made not here his brag

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Of 'Came' and 'saw' and 'overcame: ' with shame--

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That first that ever touch'd him--he was carried

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: From off our coast, twice beaten; and his shipping--

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Poor ignorant baubles!-- upon our terrible seas,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Like egg-shells moved upon their surges, crack'd

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As easily 'gainst our rocks: for joy whereof

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The famed Cassibelan, who was once at point--

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: O giglot fortune!--to master Caesar's sword,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Made Lud's town with rejoicing fires bright

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And Britons strut with courage.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Come, there's no more tribute to be paid: our

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: kingdom is stronger than it was at that time; and,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: as I said, there is no moe such Caesars: other of

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: them may have crook'd noses, but to owe such

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: straight arms, none.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Son, let your mother end.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: We have yet many among us can gripe as hard as

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Cassibelan: I do not say I am one; but I have a

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: hand. Why tribute? why should we pay tribute? If

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Caesar can hide the sun from us with a blanket, or

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: put the moon in his pocket, we will pay him tribute

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: for light; else, sir, no more tribute, pray you now.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: You must know,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Till the injurious Romans did extort

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: This tribute from us, we were free:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Caesar's ambition,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Which swell'd so much that it did almost stretch

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The sides o' the world, against all colour here

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Did put the yoke upon 's; which to shake off

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Becomes a warlike people, whom we reckon

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Ourselves to be.

speaker: Lords
text_entry: We do.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Say, then, to Caesar,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Our ancestor was that Mulmutius which

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Ordain'd our laws, whose use the sword of Caesar

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Hath too much mangled; whose repair and franchise

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Shall, by the power we hold, be our good deed,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Though Rome be therefore angry: Mulmutius made our laws,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Who was the first of Britain which did put

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: His brows within a golden crown and call'd

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Himself a king.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: I am sorry, Cymbeline,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: That I am to pronounce Augustus Caesar--

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Caesar, that hath more kings his servants than

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thyself domestic officers--thine enemy:

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Receive it from me, then: war and confusion

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: In Caesar's name pronounce I 'gainst thee: look

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: For fury not to be resisted. Thus defied,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: I thank thee for myself.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou art welcome, Caius.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thy Caesar knighted me; my youth I spent

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Much under him; of him I gather'd honour;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Which he to seek of me again, perforce,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Behoves me keep at utterance. I am perfect

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That the Pannonians and Dalmatians for

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Their liberties are now in arms; a precedent

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Which not to read would show the Britons cold:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: So Caesar shall not find them.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Let proof speak.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: His majesty bids you welcome. Make

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: pastime with us a day or two, or longer: if

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: you seek us afterwards in other terms, you

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: shall find us in our salt-water girdle: if you

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: beat us out of it, it is yours; if you fall in

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: the adventure, our crows shall fare the better

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: for you; and there's an end.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: So, sir.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I know your master's pleasure and he mine:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: All the remain is 'Welcome!'

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt
